results.title: The Mystery single vehicle crash
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”
Although many drivers involved in single vehicle crashes attribute the cause of their accidents to mechanical failures of the car, very often it was the driver and not the car who was to blame. This film stresses that while mechanical checks of one’s car are most important, it is even more vital that the driver is in good physical and mental condition before taking to the road.

results.title: The Mystery of Oberwald = Il Mistero Di Oberwald
results.brief_description: Since her husband’s death ten years ago the Queen has been mournful, reclusive and obsessed with her own death. She offers refuge for three days to a man who attempts to kill her: she warns him ‘ If you do not kill me, I’ll kill you’. However, he bears a ghost-like resemblance to the dead king and quickly her passion and love for life is rekindled. The final twist in this remarkable picture will leave you drenched with compassion and only then will you know the mystery of Oberwald. From the play by Jean Cocteau.

results.title: The Mysterious tadpole
results.brief_description: A birthday gift from Uncle McAllister turns out to be more than Louis and his parents can handle. What appeared to be a tadpole has turned out to be much, much more! Louis’s love for his pet, and his determination to keep him, makes this film heartwarming and fun!

results.title: The Mysterious Mr Tesla
results.brief_description: It was Tesla, not Edison, who invented the method of transmitting electricity which makes the 20th century work. In the 1890s Tesla also demonstrated the wireless two years before Marconi. Now a growing number of Tesla enthusiasts claim that his later research was 80 years ahead of its time.

results.title: The Mysterious caravan = Shenmi de tuodui
results.creator_credit: Tianshan Film Studio and Guang Chunlan
results.brief_description:
The story was set around the time that Chinaâ€™s Xinjiang was liberated, around the late 1940s and early 1950s. Lalai was the concubine of a cold-blooded merchant, Yushupu. After giving birth to two twin girls, Lalai was forced to leave the family with only her younger daughter, Ainur. Lalai found her lost young son, Ai Shan (from a previous marriage) in the street but she died soon. Young Ai Shan beg in the street to feed his sister, but Yushupu seized the twin girl back and made her a servant. A few years later, Ai Shan also became a servant of the Yushupu family. By the time Ai Shan and his sister grew up, Xinjiang was liberated by the Peopleâ€™s Liberation Army. Yushupu plans to escape and disguises himself as an old servant in a caravan. Ainur is disguised as a bride and Ai Shan as the majordomo, who are indeed both under the surveillance of Yushupu and his fourth concubine. Reconnaissance platoon leader, Sadikh and Batur are ordered to intercept Yushupu. The two saved the life of Ai Shan and were allowed to stay in the caravan. Yushupu was suspicious of Sadikh and Batur and tried to kill them. However, Sadikh escaped with the help of Ainur. Yushupu killed Ai Shan and wanted to kill Ainur as well as the caravan got closer and closer to the border, where they would meet Ainurâ€™s elder twin sister. Sadikh brought troops and saved Ainur. Yushupu was arrested and Ainur are eventually reunited with her sister.

Tianshan Film Studio is based in Urumqi, the capital of the Xinjiang province. Although relatively small, the film studio has produced a lot of films which represent the lives of Chinese ethnic minorities or deal with the relationship between the Han people and the minorities. The film studio has also translated a lot of Chinese-language (mandarin) films into different languages of the minorities.

The July 2009 Urumqi riots in Xinjiang suggest that the relationship between the Uyghur and Han people is not always smooth. This film presents the audience an idea of how the Uyghur people were liberated from the oppression of the exploiting class such as landlords or merchants. The filmâ€™s cast consists of mainly Uyghur people. (4 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)

results.title: The Mysterious bee (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Simon Nature Films, Australian Film Commission and Phil Simon
results.brief_description: Through the use of macro photography and slow motion filming, Phil Simon takes the viewer into the world of the honey bee. We see, first hand, the life cycle of the drone, the worker and the queen bee and their roles and interaction with each other in the colony. A highlight of the video is the fight to the death of two queen bees. Advice is also given on how to keep and handle bees.

results.title: The Mysteries of Ludwig Leicheart
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the historical journey across the Top End made by Ludwig Leicheart and his horse Rusty. They eat and sleep and upon waking, Leicheart gets attacked and killed by a dingo. Leicheart’s trusty horse avenges his master’s death by killing the dingo.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Mysteries of Hieronymus Bosch
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Anne James
results.brief_description: The extraordinary paintings of Hieronymus Bosch, painted over 400 years ago, continue to haunt and disturb us to such an extent that there is constant argument about their meaning. Dr Nicholas Baum presents an unusual detective story as he tries to unravel the mysteries of the man about whom so little is known.

results.title: The Mysteries of blood: haemostasis and blood coagulation
results.creator_credit: Sakura Motion Pictures, Eiji Murayama and Masami Sugiyama
results.brief_description: It is needless to point out the important role played by the blood for the maintenance of human life and health. In particular, the real fact about blood coagulation is one of the principal problems attracting the attention of modern medical science. This film is intended to show the complicated and clever functions concealed in the simple fact of blood coagulation. Several hitherto unsolved problems have been clarified and new spheres have been presented for future study by this film.
